title: Retro Teen Fashion
description: Remember what the cool kids wore? Test your memory of teenage fashion trends from the 1950s through 1980s!

questions.question: What matching outfit, often with a poodle applique, did teenage girls commonly wear to 1950s sock hops?
questions.explanation: The poodle skirt worn with bobby socks and saddle shoes was the quintessential 1950s teenage girl outfit, especially at sock hops and school dances.

questions.question: Which rolled-up denim style was a signature look for 1950s teenage boys who wanted to look tough?
questions.explanation: Teenage boys in the 1950s rolled up the cuffs of their blue jeans, creating a distinctive cuff that became associated with the rebel/greaser look.

questions.question: What type of short white socks, folded down at the ankle, were a must-have for teenage girls in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Bobby socks, white ankle socks folded down once or twice, were so iconic that teen girls of the era were called 'bobby-soxers.'

questions.question: What fashion trend did teenagers adopt from London's Carnaby Street in the mid-1960s?
questions.explanation: Mod fashion from London's Carnaby Street -- featuring miniskirts, bold geometric patterns, and go-go boots -- swept through American teen fashion in the mid-1960s.

questions.question: What controversial women's garment did designer Mary Quant popularize in the mid-1960s, shocking parents everywhere?
questions.explanation: Mary Quant is widely credited with popularizing the miniskirt in the mid-1960s, making hemlines shorter than anything seen before and causing generational debates.

questions.question: What type of jeans with dramatically flared legs became the must-have pants for teenagers in the early 1970s?
questions.explanation: Bell-bottom jeans, with legs that flared widely from the knee down, became the defining pants style for teenagers in the late 1960s and throughout the 1970s.

questions.question: What fashion accessory worn around the forehead was associated with the hippie teen look of the late 1960s?
questions.explanation: Headbands worn across the forehead (not pushing back the hair) became a signature accessory of the hippie movement among teenagers in the late 1960s.

questions.question: What style of decorating jeans with colorful patches, embroidery, and iron-on designs was a popular 1970s teen hobby?
questions.explanation: Customizing jeans with patches, embroidery, peace signs, and iron-on transfers was a hugely popular 1970s teen activity, making each pair unique.

questions.question: What trendy 1980s hair accessory came in neon colors and was used to pull hair into a side ponytail?
questions.explanation: Scrunchies, fabric-covered elastic hair ties, became an iconic 1980s teen accessory, often worn in bright neon colors to match the era's bold fashion.

questions.question: What 1980s fashion trend involved wearing multiple layered polo shirts with the collars popped up?
questions.explanation: Preppy teens in the 1980s wore multiple polo shirts layered on top of each other with all the collars flipped up, often in coordinating pastel colors.

questions.question: What type of t-shirt with the neck and sleeves cut off became a staple of 1980s teen fashion?
questions.explanation: Inspired by the movie 'Flashdance' (1983), teens cut the necklines and sleeves off sweatshirts to create an off-the-shoulder, casual look.

questions.question: What colorful rubber fashion accessory did teens wear stacked on their wrists in the early 1980s?
questions.explanation: Jelly bracelets, thin translucent rubber bangles in every color of the rainbow, were a must-have teen accessory in the early 1980s, worn stacked up the arm.

questions.question: What teen-oriented clothing company, founded in 1969, became known for its relaxed California-style casual wear?
questions.explanation: The Gap, founded in San Francisco in 1969, became the go-to store for teens seeking casual basics like jeans, khakis, and simple t-shirts.

questions.question: What 1950s teen fashion involved wearing a boyfriend's class ring on a chain around the neck or wrapped with yarn to fit?
questions.explanation: When a 1950s teen couple was 'going steady,' the girl would wear her boyfriend's class ring wrapped with angora yarn or tape to make it fit her finger, or on a chain.

questions.question: What brand of tight, stretchy pants became a fashion craze among teenage girls in the early 1980s?
questions.explanation: Jordache jeans, with their tight fit and horsehead logo, became a status symbol for teenage girls in the early 1980s during the designer jeans craze.
